content_clusters.consolidation_notes: Single article covering complete loan policy setup workflow for HR Admins/Super Admins
Feature documentation covering end-to-end loan request lifecycle from employee submission through HR approval and payroll integration
Grouped tickets addressing inability to delete, modify, or manage loan records after approval. Includes policy assignment gaps and disbursed loan status inflexibility.
Consolidated tickets addressing lack of self-service payroll cycle modification, reset capabilities, and 6-month restriction on cycle resets. All require backend support intervention.
Grouped tickets addressing inflexible role configuration, lack of granular permission controls for cross-module access, and insufficient employee visibility restrictions across HR modules.
Consolidated tickets addressing lack of self-service bulk deletion capabilities for payroll data, loan requests, work expenses, and manual deductions. All require manual backend support.
Grouped tickets addressing missing loan tracking features ('Paid as Cash' indicator), inactive employee visibility in loans, and loss of leave request details in payroll deductions.
Grouped tickets addressing inflexible Looker reporting configuration and loss of pay item history when payroll table rows are disabled.

Both tickets address limitations in role-based approval routing for loans. TSSD-547 identifies rigid Super Admin requirement; TSSD-1195 identifies lack of support for multiple custom roles with distinct permissions. Consolidated into single theme covering inflexible approval role configuration.

detected_integrations.description: Loan disbursement amounts are automatically created as payroll additions when loan requests are approved. Loan repayment amounts are automatically created as recurring salary deductions based on policy-defined repayment terms.
Employee loan policies may reference attendance records for eligibility determination (e.g., probation status exclusion).

Employee deletion from the main system does not automatically synchronize with payroll and loan records, creating data inconsistency issues. Inactive employee visibility in loans requires cross-module filtering.
Leave request details processed into payroll deductions are lost when the original leave request is deleted, indicating incomplete data retention across modules.
Similar bulk deletion and access control limitations exist across Work Expenses, suggesting systemic feature gaps in data management capabilities.
Loan reporting lacks flexible configuration for custom columns and status mapping, limiting visibility into loan repayment timelines and cash-based transactions.
Loan approval workflows are constrained by inflexible role configuration that prevents granular permission controls for cross-module access and data visibility segmentation.
Loan request approval routing is constrained by rigid role requirements and cannot leverage flexible custom role definitions

what_to_do.task: Create and Configure Employee Loan Policies
steps: Navigate to Settings > Payroll > Employee Loan Policies
Click 'Create New Loan Policy'
Specify policy name, description, and currency
Define loan amount limits (choose fixed amount or salary percentage method)
Set minimum and maximum loan limits
Configure repayment terms (select static or flexible repayment option)
Define payment period or monthly deduction amount
Manage employee eligibility by including/excluding specific employees
Toggle probation employee exclusion setting if applicable
Review and confirm all policy details
Activate or deactivate the policy
Save policy
what_to_do.expected_outcome: Loan policy is created with defined loan amounts, repayment terms, and employee eligibility criteria. Policy is activated and ready for employees to submit loan requests under this policy.
rules_and_constraints: Loan amounts can be set as fixed amount or percentage of salary
Minimum loan amount must be greater than 0
Employees on probation can be excluded from the policy
Repayment can be static (fixed period) or flexible (monthly deduction)
Policy names are mandatory in the system's primary language
No maximum limit specified for loan amounts or percentage
Policy can be activated or deactivated by Super Admins only
edge_cases: Employees on probation can be excluded from loan policy eligibility
Policy can be deactivated after creation, preventing new requests under that policy

steps: Check eligibility criteria for available loan policies
Prepare loan request details (loan amount, repayment preference)
Submit loan request through Bayzat platform
Receive confirmation of request submission
what_to_do.expected_outcome: Loan request is submitted successfully and moves to pending status for HR review. Employee receives confirmation and can track request status.
rules_and_constraints: Employee must meet eligibility criteria defined in the loan policy
Loan request must comply with policy-defined loan amount limits
Loan policies must be active to accept new requests
edge_cases: Employee on probation cannot submit request if excluded from policy
Loan request cannot be submitted if no active loan policies exist

what_to_do.task: Review and Process Loan Requests (HR Approval Workflow)
steps: Review pending loan request details
Validate request against applicable loan policy
Verify employee eligibility and loan amount compliance
Approve or reject the request
If approved, system automatically creates loan disbursement addition and recurring loan repayment deduction in payroll
what_to_do.expected_outcome: Loan request is approved or rejected. If approved, loan disbursement is scheduled in payroll system and repayment deductions are configured for automatic salary deduction.
rules_and_constraints: Loan request must be validated against policy-defined loan amounts and repayment terms
Loan disbursement and repayment additions/deductions are automatically created upon approval
Loan disbursement and repayment additions/deductions cannot be deleted or changed after creation
edge_cases: Loan request validation must account for employee's current salary and existing loan obligations

what_to_do.task: Manage and Track Employee Loan Requests
steps: Navigate to Finance tab and select Employee Loans section
View loan requests organized by status categories (pending, approved, rejected, added to payroll, paid)
Review pending loan requests
Approve loan requests (system automatically creates loan disbursement addition and recurring loan repayment deduction)
Reject loan requests (move request to rejected column)
Delete rejected loans if needed
Track loan status across the entire lifecycle
what_to_do.expected_outcome: HR Admin has centralized visibility of all employee loan requests across all statuses. Approved loans are automatically integrated with payroll system for disbursement and repayment processing.
rules_and_constraints: Loans can only be rejected while in pending status
Loan disbursement and repayment additions/deductions cannot be deleted or changed after creation
Loan disbursement and repayment features are only available if employee loans feature is enabled
edge_cases: Loan disbursement and repayment features are only available if employee loans feature is enabled in system settings

what_to_do.task: View Loan Details and Repayment Schedule
steps: Navigate to Payroll > Loans > My loans section
View approved loan details
Review repayment schedule showing payment periods and deduction amounts
Track loan status and remaining balance
what_to_do.expected_outcome: Employee has clear visibility of their approved loans, repayment terms, and payment schedule. Employee can track loan progress and understand their salary deductions.
rules_and_constraints: Only approved loans are visible in employee self-service view
Repayment schedule is automatically generated based on policy-defined repayment terms
edge_cases: Employee can only view their own loan records

what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Users cannot delete, modify, or manage loan records after approval. The platform restricts loan request creation for users without assigned loan policies, and loans remain in 'Disbursed' status indefinitely even after due dates pass. Administrators lack UI mechanisms to delete approved loans or bulk delete loan requests, requiring manual backend intervention.
what_to_watch_out_for.design_rationale: Loan deletion prevention maintains audit trail and financial transaction immutability for compliance purposes.

what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Administrators cannot independently modify payroll cycle dates or reset payroll modules through self-service UI. The platform enforces a 6-month restriction on payroll cycle resets and requires manual backend support intervention for any cycle adjustments. Changes cannot be reversed without support team action.

The platform lacks flexible role configuration for precise, role-specific permissions in loan approval workflows. Existing roles are too broad, forcing all-or-nothing permission structures. The Expense Manager role lacks granular permission controls to limit cross-module data visibility, and the HR employee directory lacks comprehensive access restriction functionality.

The platform lacks self-service bulk deletion capabilities for payroll data, loan requests, work expenses, and manual deductions. Users cannot independently reset payroll modules or perform comprehensive data cleanup. All deletion requests require manual backend SQL intervention by the support team, increasing operational complexity and response time.

The Employee Loans section lacks a 'Paid as Cash' indicator for precise tracking of cash-based loan transactions. The system cannot filter or hide inactive employees with ongoing loan balances, creating visual clutter. Leave request details are not retained in payroll deductions after the original request is deleted, causing potential data integrity and tracking issues.

The platform prevents deletion of historical payroll records in closed cycles to maintain audit trails, but this creates inflexibility for legitimate data management needs. Users cannot delete salary arrears for inactive employees, and loan-associated recurring deductions require complex manual workflows involving opening closed payroll months and sequential deletion of transactions. Employee deletion from the main system does not automatically synchronize with payroll table removal.
what_to_watch_out_for.design_rationale: Historical payroll record immutability ensures financial transaction integrity and prevents unauthorized retroactive modifications.

what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The Looker reporting system for employee loans lacks flexible configuration for status mapping and does not allow easy addition of custom columns for loan repayment timeline details. When payroll table cells are disabled, users cannot retrieve pay item history, creating workflow interruptions in accessing historical compensation information.

Loan approval workflows are rigidly configured to require Super Admin role and do not support creating multiple custom roles with distinct approval permissions. Organizations cannot flexibly route approvals to different role-holders or implement multi-level sequential approval processes.
